title: [Self-Directed] School-Museum Linked Mathematics Learning Design Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience in Designing Educational Programs
context.additional_context: Participants experience interactive math learning design connecting school curricula with museum exhibits. Through situational dialogue analysis and simulation practice in VR environments, they explore field trip integration strategies

learning_goals: Learners can design and implement three interaction strategies linking museum exhibits to school mathematics curricula.
Participants can perform situational dialogue mapping to analyze learning connections between classrooms and museums via VR simulations.
Instructional designers can develop math activity scenarios combining open-ended inquiry, unpredictable curiosity triggers, and playful elements.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
